topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: You look new to Freeside, so here's a little advice, friend. Don't go past the south gate greeter without talking to it first.

topics.topic_text: Thanks for the free advice. Who are you?
topics.response_text: The name's Old Ben. I've been living in Freeside since the day I was born.

topics.topic_text: Why wouldn't I want to go past the greeter?
topics.response_text: Those bots are programmed to vaporize anyone who enters the fenced-in area without authorization from the greeter.

topics.topic_text: What's your story?
topics.response_text: I've done a bit of everything around here - courier, butcher, crier, escort, gun for hire...

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Goodbye.

topics.topic_text: How would you like to work for the Garrets?
topics.response_text: I'm retired, but life has been a bit dull without some kind of action. What's the job?

topics.topic_text: Courier? I used to be a courier before I got shot in the head.
topics.response_text: Exactly one of the reasons I got out of that job. Too many shifty characters looking to have someone else move their hot items.

topics.topic_text: Butcher? How did you get into that?
topics.response_text: My father ran a butcher shop here in town, but business went downhill when another vendor started selling this strange meat at half of our prices.

topics.topic_text: That sounds odd.
topics.response_text: You're telling me. Not long after my father's shop went under and he passed away from the loss, people around town started experiencing shakes.

topics.topic_text: Crier? What was that job?
topics.response_text: After a while I made enough money to get a passport into Vegas. Back then you could get approved for entry for a fraction of what it costs now.

topics.topic_text: What happened?
topics.response_text: Well, being a suave young guy, I chatted up the ladies from time to time, and one of the managers' girls started to take a liking to me.

topics.topic_text: That's horrible!
topics.response_text: Yeah, but what can you do? I was stripped of my casino apartment and all of my belongings and booted back into Freeside.

topics.topic_text: Wrong place at the wrong time, if you ask me.
topics.response_text: Yeah, shit indeed happens. I was stripped of my casino apartment and all of my belongings and booted back into Freeside.

topics.topic_text: You said escort? Like armed guard?
topics.response_text: Well, I supposed you could look at it that way, but I was packing a whole different kind of heat. No, escort just sounds better than man-whore.

topics.topic_text: So you got paid for sex?
topics.response_text: Yep. I was damn good at my job, too. But after a while I just felt like a piece of meat and had to quit.

topics.topic_text: Oh, I could never do that.
topics.response_text: Well, I didn't have any other career opportunities open to me at the time and had to make ends meet.

topics.topic_text: Gun for hire?
topics.response_text: When I quit the escort job, I had enough money to buy a pistol belt and some other gear.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: All right.

topics.topic_text: James Garret needs a real 'boyfriend experience' for more discerning patrons.
topics.response_text: Ah, I{getcha}get you. So you think because of my past escort work, I'd be interested in that kind of thing?

topics.topic_text: You're a beacon of light in some people's depressing existence! Your work is art!
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] You know what? You're right. I looked at the whole thing from the wrong angle.

topics.topic_text: Ben, you give your clients a precious respite from the ills of the world.
topics.response_text: I never put much thought into the well-being my clients got out of my services. I suppose they only get as much as I put into it.

description:
Old Ben is a 62 year-old African American Male.

A weathered but charismatic man who has lived through numerous careers in the Mojave Wasteland. Now retired, he spends his days near the entrance to the Strip, offering advice to travelers about the dangers of unauthorized entry and occasionally sharing stories from his colorful past.

Old Ben's Personality: Charismatic, observant, and wise with a hint of cynicism earned from life's hardships. Despite his past, Ben maintains a good heart and genuinely wants to help others avoid the mistakes he made. He's street-smart and has an eye for detail, making him an excellent judge of character.

Old Ben's Backstory: Born and raised in Freeside, Ben's family once ran a butcher shop that went out of business after a mysterious vendor began selling cheaper, strange meat. When customers started showing symptoms of cannibalism, Ben suspected the truth but was ignored. After the vendor's death and discovery of human remains, Ben worked as a courier, eventually earning enough for a Strip passport. He found work as a crier at the Tops, where his charisma caught the attention of casino performers. When a manager framed him for theft, Ben was banished from the Strip and returned to Freeside. With limited options, he briefly worked as an escort before transitioning to bodyguard work. For a decade, he protected tourists in Freeside, rebuilding his reputation before retiring to live near the Strip entrance.
